p: Vulnerability assessment is a key activity in developing adaptation options for conservation outcomes [ 29]. The outcomes from a vulnerability assessment process are the identification and triaging of the vulnerable components within a system [ 30]. This presents a platform for the decision-maker to engage in further analysis or to justify strategic management actions. In this study, we aim to assess the vulnerability of freshwater fishes in Newfoundland and Labrador to climate change. The study uses a trait-based method in concert with expert knowledge. The objective of this study is to adapt the National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS) [ 31] vulnerability assessment framework to assess the vulnerability of freshwater species in Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada.
